title: How to Use the get() Command of AskUI
excerpt: This tutorial will show you how you can utilize askuis get()-command to write more powerful automation. With the get()-command you can extract the ...
content:
get()-command to write more powerful automation.

exists()-command. While that was useful, extracting information about elements such as text was impossible. If you wanted to act based on elements values or assert a state of an element with an assertion library, you could not do that!

get()-command you can extract the information askui inferred. Many more automation possibilities become available ðŸ”¥.

get() command works regarding relational selectors as Prerequisites

    You have AskUI installed (You can access Write to A Textfield

    Mobile Number on the practice page.

    Let us now see if there is a textfield that contains a text with the mobile number we just entered.
    Notice that there is no text in there as the mobile number is text element.
    Ok, so there is a textfield containing the correct number. But is it the correct textfield?
    With this you can now do assertions with your favorite library or manually:
    When you use UI Changes
    Thus the elements you saved into a variable may get invalid. Be aware of this fact and update your elements when you need an updated version.
    The "distance" of the elements. The distance is not entirely based upon physical distance, but also takes into consideration the similarity when you use Let us demonstrate this with an example. With a relational selector, you can do something like this.
    Submit button, you will get the following elements. The first two elements make sense but the third element seems to be out of order:
    ymin for example, you have to implement a sort() function of the array.
    Conclusion
    get() it is a powerful tool to get more out of your automation efforts.
    If you have a recurring or persisting issue, donâ€™t hesitate to ask the community for help!
author: johannes-dienst
